item.title: Plan of attack
item.description:
I have never really followed through on setting up a website before, but I think that this could be a good way for me to get my head around the myriad of resources available to students of history and human rights. I am not teaching right now, and I am not currently enrolled as a student, so I want to make sure that my brain isn’t complete mush when I apply to programs in the fall.

First I set up all the areas I wanted on the site, and then realized I bit off way more than I could chew - initially, at least. This project will indeed take many months. Its already been four weeks of fairly focused work to get it to this point.

My goal is to finish all of the Rwandan Genocide sections before the end of next week, when I go down to visit my family in Ventura for a few days. So far, the film section is ready to post, as is one of a possible sixteen bibliographies. Just typing that makes me realize I may need more than another week. Links are also a challenge - how much information should be on a site before I include it? Which sites are most valid? When should I say ‘enough is enough’, and end the list? I suppose those are things I will have to figure out in the next week!

item.title: Welcome!
item.description: This site is a project I have undertaken to organize web and print resources for history. It is meant to be a first-stop for individuals seeking to understand modern history and current global issues. I plan to develop it as a place to aggregate bibliographies, links, films, and useful downloads for teachers, students and curious individuals. Any recommendations of related books, sites, podcasts, blogs, and events you may wish to contribute would be greatly appreciated. Thank you for visiting!
